q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables module

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.b2op(b) → Qobj[source]
q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.create_observables_comp_basis(m: int) → list[Qobj][source]

to be added

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.create_observables_individual_qs(m: int) → list[Qobj][source]

Create list of readout operators for each qubit in m qubit basis. Each qubit is read out as |0><0| and |1><1|

Args:

s (TargetSystemSettings): settings

>>> create_readout_ops( TargetSystemSettings(m=1, gammas=(0,) ))[0]
Quantum object: dims = [[2], [2]], shape = (2, 2), type = oper, isherm = True
Qobj data =
[[1. 0.]
 [0. 0.]]

>>> create_readout_ops( TargetSystemSettings(m=1, gammas=(0,) ))[1]
Quantum object: dims = [[2], [2]], shape = (2, 2), type = oper, isherm = True
Qobj data =
[[0. 0.]
 [0. 1.]]
q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.read_00_op(tup) → Qobj[source]

Read state |0><0| on ith qubit in m qubit basis

Args:

tup (i, m): ith qubit, m qubit basis

Returns:

qt.Qobj: readout operator

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.read_11_op(tup) → Qobj[source]

Read state |1><1| on ith qubit in m qubit basis

Args:

tup (i, m): ith qubit, m qubit basis

Returns:

qt.Qobj: the readout operator

q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize.plot_ess(ts, Ess, labels)[source]
q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize.plot_evolution_computational_bs(ts: ndarray, rhoss: list[ndarray]) → axes[source]
q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize.plot_evolution_individual_qs(ts: ndarray, rhoss: list[ndarray]) → axes[source]

Plots the evolution of all rhos as a function of ts with some basic formatting.

Args:

ts (np.ndarray): times t_i rhoss (list[np.ndarray]): list of rho evolutions (for each rhos: rho_i at time t_i
